intro: Afgekia, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to the arid regions of southern Africa. These plants are characterized by their hairy, succulent leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Afgekia species are adapted to harsh, dry environments and often have deep root systems to access water. They play an important ecological role in their native habitats by providing food and shelter for various wildlife.
